org.usfirst.frc.team766.lib

Class PIDController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team766.lib.PIDController

  • public class PIDController
extends java.lang.Object
    When attempting to move something with a control loop, a PID controller can smoothly decrease the error. This class is used for the elevator, driving during autonmous, and angle correction with the gyro during the tele-operated period of the match. Because FRC's PID only supports a narrow range of things - you have to send the output directly to speed controller, etc.

    Possibly later we may create a second class that allows for different PID constants depending on which direction - this might be useful for things like arms where behavior is different depending on direction.

    Author:
    Blevenson

    • Constructor Detail

      • PIDController

        public PIDController(double P,
                     double I,
                     double D,
                     double outputmax_low,
                     double outputmax_high,
                     double threshold)
        Parameters:
        P - P constant
        I - I constant
        D - D constant
        outputmax_low - Largest output in the negative direction
        outputmax_high - Largest output in the positive direction
        threshold - threshold for declaring the PID 'done'

      • PIDController

        public PIDController(double P,
                     double I,
                     double D,
                     double threshold)
        Constructs a PID controller, with the specified P,I,D values, along with the end threshold.
        Parameters:
        P - Proportional value used in the PID controller
        I - Integral value used in the PID controller
        D - Derivative value used in the PID controller
        threshold - the end threshold for declaring the PID 'done'

        public void setSetpoint(double set)
        We may want to use same PID object, but with different setpoints, so this is separated from constructor
        Parameters:
        set - Target point to match

      • calculateDebug

        public void calculateDebug(double cur_input,
                           boolean smart)
        Same as calculate() except that it prints debugging information
        Parameters:
        cur_input - The current input to be plugged into the PID controller
        smart - True if you want the output to be dynamically adjusted to the speed controller

      • calculate

        public void calculate(double cur_input,
                      boolean smart)
        Calculate PID value. Run only once per loop. Use getOutput to get output.
        Parameters:
        cur_input - Input value from sensor
        smart - True if you want the output to be dynamically adjusted to the speed controller
